get.description:
This view returns a CSV file with a list of transactions that belong to an account address.

Reponse can be sorted according to the start_date and end_date.
If end-date is not provided, transactions starting from start_date until current date will be returned.
You can give the `asset_id` query parameter to filter transactions by asset. For ALGO, you need to give `asset_id=0`.

`/v1/accounts/<account_address>/export-history/?start_date=2022-01-01&end_date=2022-02-02&asset_id=0`

`/v1/accounts/<account_address>/export-history/?start_date=2022-01-01`

`/v1/accounts/<account_address>/export-history/?asset_id=31566704`

`/v1/accounts/<account_address>/export-history/`

Responses are limited by 20.000 transactions.

Example account that has more than the limit:

Mainnet
`GULDQIEZ2CUPBSHKXRWUW7X3LCYL44AI5GGSHHOQDGKJAZ2OANZJ43S72U`

Testnet
`RPQ3URDWR3XEWCN6X3FHRNA6EPTZG2HX224PAPOL5LPEZFNE2F7H6PDIW4`

200.description:
CSV Headers:

Date - Group ID - Transaction ID - Asset Name - Asset ID - Transfer Amount - Transaction Fees - Transfer Amount (as text) - Transaction Fees (as text) - From: Address - To: Address - Round - Transaction Type - Note - Application ID

get.description: Returns a list of names of an account.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.

get.description: Returns details of name attached to the account if exists.

Pages are ordered by asset `amount` DESC. This means *not* guarantees the USD value of assets is
bigger than the USD value of assets on the next page. Only guarantees owned amounts are bigger.

But every page is sorted by USD value in itself (aka balance_usd_value).

get.description:
Provides an overview of a single account_address.

`/v1/accounts/<account_address>/kevin/overview/`

Query parameter 'last_known_round' can be used to prevent running queries if no new transactions are available between the last_known_round and the current.

If the difference between the last_known_round and the current is larger than 50, view will fetch the new information.

If the difference between the last_known_round and the current is less than 50, and there are no new transactions in between, view will return 304.

`/v1/accounts/<account_address>/kevin/overview/?last_known_round=20202020`

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.

post.description:
Takes a list of account_address and last_know_round.
Checks if any of the accounts has new transactions since the last_know_round.
Implemented with algorand indexer.

get.description:
This public endpoint returns `Asset` verification information about a specific `ASA`
on the Algorand blockchain. This is the recommended public API for fetching the
verification status of an `ASA` from Pera. More details about the verification
program can be found here: https://explorer.perawallet.app/asa-verification/

Returns assets.

The page size can be updated with the `limit` query parameter.

`/v1/assets/?q=algo` This "q" query parameter is used to filter assets that contain the pattern in its name or asset ID.

`/v1/assets/?asset_ids=1,2,3` Filters assets by provided assets' id. It only supports up to 1000 IDs.

`/v1/assets/?status=verified` lists verified assets.

`/v1/assets/?status=unverified` lists unverified assets.

If a status query parameter is not given it will return all assets.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The pagination cursor value.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

post.description: Calculates and returns the maximum possible fee amount that Pera might take in micro Algos.

`transactions`: List of `msgpack` encoded transactions that need to be signed by user to be able to complete the swap operation.

`signed_transactions`: List of `msgpack` encoded signed transactions that need to be sent to the node to be able to complete the swap operation.

Note that `transactions[i]` is the unsigned version of `signed_transactions[i]`. If `signed_transactions[i]` is `null`,
`transactions[i]` needs to be signed by the user and replaced with `signed_transactions[i]`.

`asset_in|out_id` is `0` for Algo.

Algo might be returned in the response with `asset_id = 0` just like other assets.

503.description: One of the requested providers is unavailable.

get.description:
This public endpoint returns details of an asset.

- Response is cached for 5 min.

This is a simplified endpoint that returns all labeled assets in a single response. The endpoint returns verified and suspicious assets with asset verification label by excluding unverified ones. If your business logic needs to know the labeled asset ids, this is the endpoint you should use. It is lightweight and doesn't require pagination.
- Response is cached for 5 min.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.

get.description:
This is a simplified endpoint that returns all verified assets in a single response. The endpoint returns verified assets with asset verification label by excluding suspicious and unverified ones. If your business logic needs to know the verified asset ids, this is the endpoint you should use. It is lightweight and doesn't require pagination.
- Response is cached for 5 min.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Which field to use when ordering the results.

post.description:
This endpoint returns `Asset` information about a specific `ASA` on the Algorand blockchain.
It also includes `Collectible` information when applicable.
This endpoint also returns the favorite and price alert status of the asset for the specified device.

This endpoint sets the favorite status of an asset for the specified device.
The client must explicitly specify whether to enable or disable the favorite status.

POST /v2/assets/{asset_id}/toggle-favorite/

This endpoint sets the price alert status of an asset for the specified device.
The client must explicitly specify whether to enable or disable the price alert status.

POST /v2/assets/{asset_id}/toggle-price-alert/

- Creates a device and an authentication token (`auth_token`) for it. If you call with same
(`push_token`, `platform`) pair, will update device and re-create `auth_token`.

- **Please note that you cannot get the authentication token again except the time of creation.**

- You can set `app_version` with `APP-VERSION` header.

parameters.name: APP-VERSION
parameters.description: Change App Version

parameters.name: APP-VERSION
parameters.description: Change App Version

parameters.name: APP-VERSION
parameters.description: Change App Version

post.description:
This endpoint designed for devices which used device v1 logic and will use device v2 logic. If client doesn't
has 'auth_token' but if it has device 'id' then this endpoint will create new `auth_token` or create very new device.

- **IMPORTANT**: Requested device `id` and returned device `id` could be different. This endpoint might create new device.
- **IMPORTANT 2**: It is not a "create new auth_token" endpoint. This endpoint **will deprecate** after sometime. Use this only
 if you know device `id` but don't know `auth_token`. Which means client has used device v1 endpoints before and it is the
 first time to need to use device v2 endpoints.

parameters.name: APP-VERSION
parameters.description: Change App Version
